attributes.action: Get rid of the national speed limit sign and just put the speed limit.
attributes.background: For example when you are driving you shouldn't have to work out the speed limit it should be on the sign it works for all the other speed limits so I don't see why it can't work for 60 and 70 mph roads

attributes.action: Make Religious Education optional
attributes.background: I am in Year 10 and we have to do RE. It is long and boring so I think that it should be optional. I am not religious yet I still have to learn about Christianity and Hinduism.
attributes.additional_details: It shouldn't affect the current Year 10 and 11s but should affect the upcoming Year 10s

attributes.action: Debate possibility that the "Peoples Will" has changed since Scotland Referendum
attributes.background:
In 2014 the Scottish public voted to Remain a part of the UK and it is increasingly evident that the full implications were not considered regarding Remain in the run-up to the referendum. 

Numerous polls suggest there would now be a clear majority to Leave.
attributes.additional_details: Any such debate should be before any Brexit implications debate as this referendum was in 2014 and the EU Leave/Remain vote was in 2016.

attributes.action: Call for an international sporting boycott of the USA due to its discrimination
attributes.background: The US ban on muslim entry ignores several elements of The Geneva convention on Human rights:  "freedom of thought, conscience and religion" , "equality before the law" and "presumption of innocence until proven guilty". The ban will be used as "evidence" to incite and recruit potential terrorists.
attributes.additional_details: Dividing communities and creating an illusion of a war with Islam will provide "evidence" for those trying to recruit followers to terrorist groups. The ban could cause even those whose inclination is against violence to reconsider. It also introduces a dangerous direction of movement for the country which likes to be considered the leader of the free world. The sporting boycott showed South Africa how strongly the world disapproved of apartheid. A sporting Boycott of America would do the same.

attributes.action: Make a plastic tax, anything with a plastic wrapping you have to pay a 2p tax
attributes.background: I want to make a plastic tax so all plastic products sold have to pay a 2p plastic tax the money made will go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish and help repopulate the sea with sea life.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 8 billion tonnes of plastic is dumped into the ocean every year. Fish then eat it and then it works it way into our diet. Pvc is the most dangerous man made object and it's 30% of all plastic. It can cause cancer.
Plastic doesn't erode for 450 to 1000 year's

attributes.action: Carbon tax products from countries reneging on their climate change commitments
attributes.background: UK taxpayers and businesses pay a considerable amount, though direct and indirect taxation, to help the country meet its climate change commitments.  However, some countries are making little effort to reduce carbon emissions, and some are reneging on agreed clime change commitments and treaties.

attributes.action: Raise paternity pay to a minimum of 75% of your weekly income
attributes.background: Currently paternity leave is around £140 or 90% of your weekly income whichever is lower. Due to this fathers cant afford to take time off to be with a newborn or have to take annual leave. I myself just had a child and cant take paternity leave as I would be over £200 out of pocket each week.
attributes.additional_details: Lets get this to parliament and give fathers the chance to be with their kids from the start. There are all these fathers who don't want to spend time with their kids and the ones who do can't. Lets change this for fathers and kids in the UK lets allow fathers to bond with their newborns. Please sign this petition. THANKS

attributes.action: Any public promise made by any holder of public office to be legally binding.
attributes.background: Holders of public office frequently promise to act on behalf of those who, ultimately employ them.  They also frequently break those promises, usually with impunity.  This lessens public trust and engagement, particularly in the field of politics.
attributes.additional_details: When a public figure makes a promise they are, essentially, making a contract with those people who employ them, elect them, or pay their salaries.  In response to these promises, we elect them, or allow them to retain their position - it is only fair and right that they should be required to stick to their promises, and yet, time and again, they do not.  There is not, at the moment, any realistic sanction available to us to prevent this, so I am proposing that there should be.

attributes.action: Referendum for England & Wales to leave the UK if we don't leave the EU & Laws
attributes.background: It was clear in the referendum that the free movement of Labour was one of the main reasons people voted to leave the EU. We do not want to be bound by the EU or any of its laws and this includes the single market and especially free movement of people. IF Scotland can push for this then so can I/we
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the refruredum leave campaign about controlling immigration, via using a different system and taking back control of our laws.

attributes.action: Protect employee privacy by making electronic monitoring illegal
attributes.background: In some companies employees are tracked so closely that their managers can see if they pause between tasks or, even stop for a chat. Some companies are even monitoring workers metabolism. Some use 'badges worn by employees to record their movements, interactions and “speaking patterns”
attributes.additional_details:
Employment monitoring article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/20/digital-giants-workers-robots-film-employee-monitoring-the-circle

BBC news Which! Report on personal data being sold. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-38694016

New York Times
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/18/technology/data-crunching-is-coming-to-help-your-boss-manage-your-time.html

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all major UK roads and round-a-bouts to have CCTV
attributes.background: I am A university student at MMU. After experiencing a car crash on the underpass of Mancunion way on a major round-a-bout with both my flatmate and her friend. The police as helpful as they were, had no CCTV to catch the culprit.
attributes.additional_details:
The police, although busy, were wonderful in regards to the situation. After a Nissan Juke hitting a little car into a lamppost, the car was a write off. The man drove off, before we were even out of the car and the police, afterwards, informed us that there were no CCTV on the round-a-bout or on any of the roads in the direction he went.

I'm aware of multiple others having similar experiences, and feel that it would be both beneficial to the victims and the police to have CCTV on major roads.

attributes.action: Make 'having somewhere to call home’ affordable again.
attributes.background: Too many people in our country can no longer afford to live comfortably and without unreasonable stress. This is already a crisis and must be addressed NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose the following as a ’starting place’:
- UK house prices should rise in line with the average UK individual wage; regulation should be in place to prevent prices rising in line with what people can borrow.
- Regulation should be in place to ensure that UK average monthly rent for any domestic property does not exceed UK average monthly mortgage payments made by home-owners in similar properties.
- Banks should be heavily taxed for every non-repayment mortgage they issue.

attributes.action: Stop funding Free Childcare for parents who do not work
attributes.background: The Government currently fund free childcare places for children over 2 years old, if the parents fall within a set 'eligibility criteria'. This includes Job Seekers Allowance. Surely parents who are unemployed can look after their own children. Maybe Job Centre can issue vouchers for interviews etc

attributes.action: Make London into a free WiFi city.
attributes.background: The government should implement free WiFi in London. This would give access to people who ordinarily would not be able to afford it. It would also encourage businesses and citizens to move to London. It has been tested in many cities around the world with great success.

attributes.action: Amend the Children Act to allow courts the power to change birth certificates
attributes.background: The government should draft an amendment to the law to allow courts power under the Children Act 1989 to decide in exceptional circumstances if it is in the long term interests of the child to change the child's surname on the birth certificate to reflect a new surname ordered by the courts.
attributes.additional_details:
The law allows a facility for one parent to remove the wrong fathers details from the birth certificate and re-register the birth to include the natural fathers details.

A court can order that a child is to be known by a new surname, but has no power to decide whether that new surname should be reflected on the birth certificate. The other parent's permission is needed for such a change, if this is not gained the wrong father's surname will remain on the entry indefinitely requiring a deed poll.

attributes.action: Prime Ministers should explain why they have not implemented their manifesto
attributes.background: Governments regularly never implement manifesto pledges. Create a law that forces The Prime Minister before a General Election to explain to Parliament why pledges have not been implemented as described.
attributes.additional_details: Trust in politicians is at an all time low, people do not believe what they say. This simple law will encourage political parties to create a manifesto that they can realistically implement. I'm tired of politicians broken promises.

attributes.action: Glaucoma  patients who need their eye pressure  checked should not be charged.
attributes.background: At present Glaucoma patients can only have their eye pressure tests done once a year covered at NHS cost, if there is a need to monitor the eye pressure to prevent going blind

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Stop government funding to FA unless it withdraws from FIFA
attributes.background: Folowing on-going coruption allegations and FIFA imposing fines on UK teams for wearing poppies the home nation Football Associations should receive no funding, recognition  or support of any kind from the UK government until they withdraw from FIFA and set up an alternative world cup tournament

attributes.action: charge UKentrants £10 a week insurance to cover possible use of our NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a lot of money is lost from free treatment and chasing for payment for treatment with a set duty of £10 a week Im sure the NHS would be a lot better off

attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Dont allow food companies to add air to food packages to make them look bigger.
attributes.background: Food manufacturers are filling food packages with air. This is wrong as we are being tricked to buying food and finding out that in food packaging a small percentage is actual food and a large percentage is filled with air! Food with packaging should have a limit to the amount of air it has.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence that manufacturers are filling food packages with air-

http://www.msn.com/en-gb/foodanddrink/foodnews/shocking-x-ray-images-reveal-how-food-manufacturers-are-cheating-shoppers-by-filling-packages-with-air/ar-AAltXRN?li=AAcVLvg&ocid=spartandhp

attributes.action: Make it illegal for individuals or businesses to own more than 3 houses.
attributes.background: I can understand having second, even third homes but the property market is out of control and will continue to be so given the economic environment we live in. The damage here is to social mobility, community, growing inequality and to people who are low-medium skilled.
attributes.additional_details:
I see no appropriate or logical reason to own multiple (I.e more than 3). There is no justifiable reason that I can see. 

Business will get around this so there will need to be incredibly tight restrictions on commercial properties and a rigorous approach to those looking to bypass the law.

attributes.action: Give grandparents the same funding as foster parents whether they work or not
attributes.background: Payment for grandparents who have grandchildren fulltime.
attributes.additional_details: Me and my husband work but can only get child benefit for 2 grandchildren who live with us fulltime so if they need clothes or shoes or anything else and it is more than £34 we have to pay for it. I think there should be some sort of payment like foster parents get because grandparents are doing the same job.

attributes.action: Government should ban competency based interviews.
attributes.background:
The Government should ban competence based interviews as they ignore education, knowledge, skills and past working experience of good candidates and can also be used to discriminate against candidates without detection.

Bring back the old interview system that helped make Britain Great.
attributes.additional_details:
A fair system of scoring candidates should be:
1.	Experience –with proof (25%)
2.	Education- with proof (25%)
3.	Knowledge/ Experience – with proof (25%)
4.	Competencies – through interview (25%)

attributes.action: reverse the the decision not to allow cashing in of annuities
attributes.background: many people had made financial arrangements based on the promise that annuities could be cashed in

attributes.action: Allow "hoverboards" to be used on pavements
attributes.background: Currently hoverboards are not allowed on the public pavements. Many countries such as the USA and other EU countries are allowing it and they are after all a useful mode of transport. Unfortunately an out of date highways act says that we can't and it's high tide this is changed.

attributes.action: Forbid the use of CCTV by local councils for parking enforcement purposes
attributes.background: I am writing this as my local council is using a CCTV camera on a regular basis for the purpose of parking enforcement. The guidelines state this method should be used only "where other means of enforcement are not practical" - but nothing is more practical that a cheap and covert CCTV camera.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from section 1.13 of Surveillance Camera Code of Practice, June 2013, Home office:

"Motorists may regard enforcement by cameras as over-zealous and relevant authorities should use them sparingly. Such systems should , therefore, only be deployed where other means of enforcement are not practical and their effectiveness in achieving this purpose is subject to regular review."

attributes.action: Placejob seekers on work programs within 6weeks of oringially signing on
attributes.background: To change the official help and courses job seekers receive down to 6 weeks of being unemployed rather than 6 months - the government needs to recognise that just because that a person has only just signed on, they may have been out of work a lot longer.

attributes.action: Introducing a theory test with Motorcycle Compulsory basic training
attributes.background: Motorcycles are an increasing form of transport, from delivery, commuting to pleasure. New motorcycle riders with no experience can legally ride without adequate training. Learner Motorcycle riders do not need to pass a theory test, producing inconsiderate, dangerous riders with poor road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislation states that a rider, whether young, old and of all level of experiences can learn to ride a motorcycle on the roads by simply completing a Compulsory basic training course. 
This consists of a manoeuvring and bike control session, then a road competence ride which is supervised.
During the CBT an instructor will assess your knowledge of the Highway code. This is not enough, too many riders put themselves at risk by not fully understanding the rules of the road.

attributes.action: Review how families are means tested for benefits.
attributes.background:
Why is it only those who do not work or those on low income that get support from the government?

What about those hard working families with a household salary that looks great on paper, who pay thousands in taxes a year, that struggle to afford everyday living costs?
attributes.additional_details:
I personally think there needs to be a complete over-hall in how people are means tested in order to receive benefits and what financial help is made available to all families that struggle regardless of their household income.

My self and my partner on paper have a pretty good household income. Just over £50k a year. However, when you take away costs such as rent/mortgage, utility bills, childcare, travel, food, and everyday living we are left with not much to spare.

attributes.action: Give photo ID cards to Veterans
attributes.background: I  joined my regular Battalion The Royal Welch Fusiliers. During my time in The RWF I was lucky enough to visit such places as Germany, Cyprus, Central America (Belize) and of course visited Northern Ireland four times ( 1973, 1974, 1075 & 1976)

attributes.action: Ensure that Boxing Day is held specifically on 26th December. Day after Xmas day
attributes.background: If 26 Dec is on a Sun, Boxing Day in the UK is moved to 27 Dec. In the UK, Boxing Day is a bank holiday. If Boxing Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is a substitute bank holiday. On occasion when Xmas Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is Boxing Day and Tue a substitute bank holiday for Xmas.
attributes.additional_details:
The intention is to fix Boxing Day to the 26th Dec regardless of what day it falls on so that it is observed formally as a national holiday.

This would mean that if Boxing Day falls on a Saturday or a Sunday, that day is observed as Boxing Day and (Sunday) the Day of Rest is observed on the Monday instead.

This Petition is about recognising the priorities and people and how times have changed. Boxing Day would be given priority over business and Sunday day of rest.

attributes.action: Make all GP's open for half a day every Saturday or Sunday
attributes.background: There are so many people that can't get time off work for doctor's appointments due to their regular working weeks, example, 9-5 Monday to Friday. Opening the GP's for a couple of hours at the weekend will allow for those that struggle to arrange doctor's appointments without having to book holidays
attributes.additional_details: I work as a healthcare assistant, Monday to Friday, if i didn't turn up to work their would be vulnerable adults left at risk, but I still need to look after my own health, if I get ill so do my clients. Why should I have to book holiday to see the doctor.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from automatically opting us in to third party marketing.
attributes.background: When calling various service providers such as car insurance companies, housing insurance, mobile phone companies there is often a prerecorded massage at the start of the call stating that they will pass on your details to third party companies for marketing purposes, you need to ask to be opted out
attributes.additional_details:
Having spent 20 minutes online trying to get car insurance quotes and speaking to 1 company who had a similar pre recorded message that was unable to provide the required service I have been plagued by sales calls trying to sell me similar and unrelated products due to being automatically opted in.

This practice is wrong and parasitic, if companies want to sell or benefit from marketing your details they should be the ones asking, the burden to opt out should not be placed on the consumer.

attributes.action: Equality and fairness : Child Benefit system
attributes.background: Separated parents (with parental responsibility) that have shared custody of their children should be allowed to have an equal share in the benefits received for the children; the current system only allows one person to claim for child benefit.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for new Vehicles to have automatic emergency braking
attributes.background: To help prevent accidents and deaths on the road by making it a legal requirement for new cars, vans and trucks to have automatic emergency braking systems

attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by £5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of £9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Government must do more to help councils build more council homes
attributes.background: The lack of affordable housing is a chronic problem, and has got worse as years have gone on. I became disabled due to a fall at work, and am now in wheelchair. I suffer with chronic pain. I'm stuck in a first floor flat have been trying for years to get a bungalow or ground floor flat with no luck.

attributes.action: Make the mechanics behind weight gain and loss compulsory for secondary schools
attributes.background: 64% of the UK population is overweight/obese. Many simply don’t understand why they are obese, and thus do not have the first idea of how to combat it. Basic information such as calculating Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) should be taught in secondary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
The average British person’s total daily energy expenditure is 2000 calories. Eating just 100 calories over this per day will lead to an average weight gain of nearly 10.5 pounds (4.7kg) a year. 100 calories is one large apple, half a plain bagel, or a packet of crisps.

Being overweight or obese is connected to many health problems, such as high blood pressure, diabetes, sleep apnoea and some cancers, as well as significantly reducing life expectancy and quality of life.

attributes.action: Add an extra voting option to the next election of "Electoral Reform!"
attributes.background: Every year I vote for an less popular party as a type of "rebel" vote. This is the only way I feel heard. Now is the time to allow the public to express their concerns about the way OUR government is elected! Brexit has given us a new opportunity to concentrate on The UK! Let us be heard!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/

attributes.action: Compensate overseas pensioners re post Brexit drop in the Pound.
attributes.background: We, pensioners aged 72 & 79 (ex RAF- now 70% disabled)  left Britain in 1991 to go and live in France. After 19 years we joined our daughter in Germany. We know about fluctations of the Pound, but enough is enough. Since the referendum we have lost around 100 E every 4 weeks and it's getting worse!
attributes.additional_details:
My husband receives a Basic Pension (85%) and attendance allowance payments 4(weekly) , I receive the married woman's part of his pension.
The first payments after  the referendum were minus 92 Euros and with each subsequent payment the minus has increased. It's shocking. I can supply details if required.

attributes.action: It should be law that the Governor of the Bank of England is a UK Citizen
attributes.background: The UK leads the world in its financial expertise, and there are UK citizens experienced in this field that could do the job, but the position is currently held by a non UK national.

attributes.action: Have an annual referendum on the most signed petition to make it legally binding
attributes.background: In late 2006 the government set up the e-petitions website as a way for people to engage with politics. Millions of people have signed petitions, but we still don't feel like these petitions are given any real attention or importance. Petitions having the chance to become laws would change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The e-petitions website was created in November 2006 and the created petitions cover everything from tax to immigration, moral and ethical concerns, education, science and the very direction of the country. 

In 2015, the BBC reported "an unnamed government minister branded the site an own-goal thought up by a "prat"". 
People still don't feel the issues they are passionate about are taken seriously. We create and sign petitions because we want to see change, we want our voices to be heard.

attributes.action: Smoking Should be Banned on Outside Station Platforms (Especially Merseyrail)
attributes.background:
"Smoking is permitted on our surface stations" - Merseyrail.org

Merseyrail allow smoking on their surface (i.e. outside) platforms. This is a disgrace! Platforms can become very congested with people and thus causing others to inhale second-hand smoke, including children and pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
One might argue that smoking is okay as it is still considered outside. However on the street people have the option to cross the road or move away whereas, at a station platform passengers do not have this option and instead must inhale second-hand smoke. 

London Overground stations prohibited smoking on surface platforms. Merseyrail is clearly behind modern times. If London has adopted this policy then why hasn't Merseyrail?

It is of this author's opinion that the Health Act 2006 should be amended so that smoking should be banned on any train platforms in England.

attributes.action: Increase Government powers over interest rates to protect savers.
attributes.background: Since 2008 the Bank of England has relentlessly cut interest rates causing savers to lose a considerable amount of income and this has now reached an unacceptable level.  At the moment, the Government has limited power over interest rates.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls for greater Government powers of the Bank of England's interest rates, so that savers can be protected.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: I propose that the government should pay for otter fences around fisheries.
attributes.background: It is becoming widely known that commercial fisheries and national river fishery stocks are being attacked by otters. Peoples livelihoods are at stake and as fishing is the largest participated sport in Britain I feel our sport is in jeopardy.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://www.wiltsglosstandard.co.uk/
A link hi lighting the problem.

attributes.action: Cap credit card, loans and catalogue companies from charging high APR
attributes.background: Credit card companies are charge APR as high as 59.9%, we have shops on the high street charging higher, then we have advertisements of pay day loans, provident. these high interest charges are just going to get more people in debt, which results in bankruptcy so the tax pay foots the bill.

attributes.action: Motor no-claims bonuses to be gained by claim-free years. not type of motor.
attributes.background: It should be illigal to allow a clause that legally allows companies to charge more money, because they won't recognize no-claims bonuses gained from driving Taxis/Vans/HGV/PSV etc.
attributes.additional_details: I have over 20 years of acciden- free driving gained on HGVs, PSVs, Ambulances and Taxis, yet any car insurance company will only allow no-claims gained with a car. Thus costing more money. LEGAL THEFT.
